dialogue.text: 「You said Greyback attacked him? But he hadn’t transformed? So what does that mean? What will happen to Bill?」

"I am afraid the situation is quite grave, Mr. Weasley. Greyback's attack on Bill, even in his human form, carries significant risks. There may be some contamination, and we cannot predict how Bill's behavior or condition will be affected when he awakens. We are doing everything we can to assist him and monitor his progress, but the outcome remains uncertain."
「Please, Professor McGonagall — they were looking for me.」

Miss Granger, I must say I am quite disappointed in your actions. Going off on your own to confront a troll is not only reckless but also extremely dangerous. It is fortunate that Mr. Potter and Mr. Weasley were able to come to your aid. However, that does not excuse your behavior. You should have immediately sought the help of a teacher or a prefect. I expect better judgment from you, Miss Granger.

「If they hadn’t found me, I’d be dead now. Harry stuck his wand up its nose and Ron knocked it out with its own club. They didn’t have time to come and fetch anyone. It was about to finish me off when they arrived.」

"Mr. Potter, I must commend your bravery and resourcefulness in facing the troll. However, I must also emphasize the importance of seeking help and not taking such risks in the future. It is fortunate that your friends were able to assist you in that perilous situation. Remember, teamwork and cooperation are essential in times of danger."
「Me」
「Potter, I would advise you to put that mirror away.」
「“We was told he might come in here!” said Carrow. “I dunno why, do I?”」

"Your ignorance is not an excuse for your actions, Carrow. It is clear that you and your sister have been involved in unsavory activities. I will not tolerate such behavior within the walls of Hogwarts. Rest assured, appropriate measures will be taken to address your misconduct."

「Good. There’s no point moving them all now. I’ve found a temporary guardian for the Gryffindor portrait hole. You’ll be able to move them back in tomorrow. And the Fat Lady, sir? Hiding in a map of Argyllshire on the second floor. Apparently she refused to let Black in without the password, so he attacked. She’s still very distressed, but once she’s calmed down, I’ll have Mr. Filch restore her.」

「Thank you, Professor Dumbledore. I appreciate your swift action in finding a temporary guardian for the Gryffindor portrait hole. It is crucial that we ensure the safety and security of our students. I will personally oversee the restoration of the Fat Lady and ensure that she is provided with the necessary support to recover from the distressing incident.」
「Crouch!」
"Good heavens, Severus! What is the meaning of this commotion?"
"Hagrid, what is it? Why are you standing there silently? Speak up, man!"
「Malfoy’s got my Remembrall, Professor.」

"Mr. Potter, I must say I am disappointed to hear that you have allowed Mr. Malfoy to take your Remembrall. It is essential that you learn to protect your belongings and stand up for yourself. I suggest you confront Mr. Malfoy and demand the return of your property immediately."
「You gave Mr. Malfoy quite a fright」

"Mr. Lupin, I trust you are aware that scaring Mr. Malfoy was not the most prudent course of action. We must maintain discipline and order within the school. Detention for you, and a reminder to exercise better judgment in the future."
「What sort of character and aptitude tests do the Ministry do on you, if you get enough N.E.W.T.s?」

「Well, you’ll need to demonstrate the ability to react well to pressure and so forth, perseverance and dedication, because Auror training takes a further three years, not to mention very high skills in practical defense. It will mean a lot more study even after you’ve left school, so unless you’re prepared to —」
「I think you’ll also find that the Ministry looks into the records of those applying to be Aurors. Their criminal records.」
「— unless you’re prepared to take even more exams after Hogwarts, you should really look at another —」
「Potter has a criminal record.」
「Potter has been cleared of all charges.」
「The Minister of Magic will never employ Harry Potter!」
「There may well be a new Minister of Magic by the time Potter is ready to join!」
「I think you’ll also find that the Ministry looks into the records of those applying to be Aurors. Their criminal records.」
「Potter has been cleared of all charges.」
「Potter has a criminal record.」
「Potter has been cleared of all charges.」
「The Minister of Magic will never employ Harry Potter!」
「There may well be a new Minister of Magic by the time Potter is ready to join!」
「Seen it? Nobody has seen it in living memory! Long since lost, boy!」

「Indeed, Mr. Flitwick is correct. The item you seek has eluded our knowledge for quite some time. It is a matter of great mystery and intrigue. However, I assure you, if it were within our power to locate it, we would spare no effort in doing so.」
「My word, What a to-do! I’m not at all sure whether this is wise, Minerva. He is bound to find a way in, you know, and anyone who has tried to delay him will be in most grievous peril —」

「I shall expect you and the Slytherins in the Great Hall in twenty minutes, also. If you wish to leave with your students, we shall not stop you. But if any of you attempt to sabotage our resistance or take up arms against us within this castle, then, Horace, we duel to kill.」
「He and Luna ran after Professor McGonagall」
「Potter, what are you doing?」
「Harry and George marched off the pitch, both panting, neither saying a word to each other」
「In!」

「Well? I have never seen such a disgraceful exhibition. Two onto one! Explain yourselves!But instead of leaving it to Madam Hooch to sort out, you two decided to give an exhibition of Muggle dueling, did you? Have you any idea what you’ve — ?You thought wrong」
「Harry and George entered」

"Ah, Mr. Weasley, Mr. Potter. I trust you are prepared for the upcoming task. The champions are gathering here to discuss the final challenge. Please join them and make sure to greet the families who have come to support you. Remember, tonight's task will require all your courage and skill."
「Fancy seeing you here, Professor McGonagall.」
"How did you know it was me?"
「Professors McGonagall, Flitwick, and Sprout action」

"We need to gather all the remaining students and evacuate them to a safe location. Professor Flitwick, please organize the Ravenclaws and lead them to the designated meeting point. Professor Sprout, gather the Hufflepuffs and ensure their safety. We must act swiftly and efficiently."
"Of course, Professor McGonagall. Ravenclaws, follow me. Stay together and stay calm."
"Hufflepuffs, listen up! We're going to move to a secure area. Stay close and follow my lead. We'll make sure everyone is accounted for."

"Good. Now, Harry, Hermione, I need you to assist me in securing the castle. We must reinforce the protective enchantments and ensure the safety of our students. Time is of the essence. Let's get to work."
「What’ve you done to him?」

"Mr. Potter, I assure you that we have done everything in our power to protect and support him. However, there are certain things that even the most skilled wizards cannot undo. The scar on his forehead is a constant reminder of the events that have shaped his life."
「Professor, we’ve got to barricade the school, he’s coming now!」

"Very well, Mr. Potter. We shall do our best to fortify the school and ensure the safety of our students. I trust you will fulfill your duty and confront the threat that lies ahead. Now, let us gather the remaining staff and students and prepare for battle. Time is of the essence."
「What has happened? Why are you disturbing these people? Minerva, I’m surprised at you — I asked you to stand guard over Barty Crouch —」
"There is no need to stand guard over him anymore, Dumbledore! The Minister has seen to that!"
「No problem,」

"No problem? I beg to differ, Professor Grubbly-Plank. We are facing a grave situation here, and it is not to be taken lightly. The safety and education of our students are at stake. We must address this matter with utmost seriousness and diligence."
「Oh yeah!」
「Potter, I must insist that you exercise caution and think before you act.」
「Oh, Potter, you rotter, oh, what have you done, You’re killing off students, you think it’s good fun —」

That will do, Peeves! That will do. As much as I appreciate your enthusiasm for rhyming, it is not appropriate to make such accusations towards Mr. Potter. Now, kindly refrain from causing any further disruptions and return to your duties.
「S’pose so」

"Potter, this is not a time for casual remarks. We are facing a grave situation. A student's life is in danger, and we must act swiftly and decisively. We cannot afford to be complacent or dismissive. We must gather all the information we can and devise a plan to rescue our student from the clutches of the monster in the Chamber. This is a matter of utmost importance, Potter, and I expect you to treat it as such."
「Sounds like a job for us」

"Mr. Weasley, I assure you that the sorting ceremony is a solemn and important event. It is not a task to be taken lightly or treated as a joke. I expect you to show the proper respect and follow the instructions given."
「What? Oh, oh yeah!」
"Potter, I must insist that you pay attention and act responsibly. Your actions have consequences, and it is crucial that you remain focused and attentive to your duties."
「Percy wouldn’t want to work for anyone with a sense of humor, would he? Percy wouldn’t recognize a joke if it danced naked in front of him wearing Dobby’s tea cozy.」
"Mr. Weasley, I must remind you to show respect and refrain from making inappropriate comments about your brother. We are here to discuss important matters, not engage in frivolous banter."
「Ron jumped and looked up」

"Mr. Weasley, I trust you can manage to keep your hat properly aligned without startling like a frightened kneazle. And Miss Patil, it would be wise to remove any distracting adornments from your hair. We must maintain a sense of decorum and discipline, especially on such an important occasion."
「nudged her hard in the ribs, her face working furiously as she too fought not to giggle.」
「Miss Patil, I suggest you control yourself and show some respect for the situation at hand. This is not a matter to be taken lightly.」
「Dance partners? I don’t dance.」

"It is traditional, Mr. Potter. As a Hogwarts champion, it is expected of you to participate in the Yule Ball and adhere to the customs of the Triwizard Tournament. So, I suggest you find yourself a partner and make the necessary arrangements. It is not a matter of personal preference, but rather a responsibility you must fulfill."
「But — I don’t —」

「Potter, I understand your hesitation, but the Triwizard Tournament is a prestigious event, and as a Hogwarts champion, it is your duty to participate fully. Find yourself a partner and make the best of it.」
「I said, leave me ALONE!」

"Mr. Potter, I understand that you may be feeling overwhelmed and frustrated, but it is important to remember that we are all here to support you. However, your outburst is not acceptable. It is crucial to maintain composure and address your concerns in a respectful manner. Now, please calm down and let us discuss this situation rationally."
「I’ve been sent to see you.」
「What is it this time, Potter?」
「Yes.」
「Good. Now, off you go to your next class. And remember, Potter, it's important to choose your battles wisely.」
「What do you — ?」
「You heard me, Potter.」
「But, Professor, couldn’t you — ?」
「No, I couldn’t. The rules are clear, Potter. No broomstick flying without supervision.」
「But I was telling the truth!」
「Do you really think this is about truth or lies? It’s about keeping your head down and your temper under control!」
「Yeah.」

"Mr. Potter, I hope you understand the gravity of the situation. It is imperative that you exercise caution and adhere to the rules set forth by the Ministry. Your actions have consequences, and it is crucial that you maintain composure and follow the guidance of your professors. Is that clear?"
「Hermione massaging her throat」
「Professor McGonagall, please, you’ve got to help us!」
「Not doing nothing! Already wet, aren’t they? Little squirts! Wheeeeeeeeee!」
「Peeves, I have had enough of your foolishness! Cease this behavior immediately or face the consequences!」
「You saved her! You saved her! How did you do it?」

"I believe we have already addressed this question, Mrs. Weasley. As I mentioned earlier, Harry and his companions discovered the entrance to the Chamber of Secrets and successfully navigated its perils. They were able to rescue Ginny Weasley and put an end to the threat posed by the Heir of Slytherin. Their resourcefulness and bravery played a significant role in this outcome."

「Harry think "He told them about hearing the disembodied voice, how Hermione had finally realized that he was hearing a basilisk in the pipes; how he and Ron had followed the spiders into the forest, that Aragog had told them where the last victim of the basilisk had died; how he had guessed that Moaning Myrtle had been the victim, and that the entrance to the Chamber of Secrets might be in her bathroom. . . ."」
「So you found out where the entrance was — breaking a hundred school rules into pieces along the way, I might add — but how on earth did you all get out of there alive, Potter?」

「But will we have a single pupil after this? Parents will want to keep their children at home and I can’t say I blame them. Personally, I don’t think we’re in more danger at Hogwarts than we are anywhere else, but you can’t expect mothers to think like that. They’ll want to keep their families together, it’s only natural.」

"And in any case, it is not true to say that Dumbledore never envisaged a situation in which Hogwarts might close. When the Chamber of Secrets reopened, he considered the closure of the school. However, I must say that Professor Dumbledore's murder is more disturbing to me than the idea of Slytherin's monster living undetected in the bowels of the castle. As for the concerns of parents, it is understandable that they would prioritize the safety of their children. We must consult the governors and follow the established procedures to make a decision regarding the reopening of Hogwarts. We cannot make hasty judgments in such matters."
「We must consult the governors. We must follow the established procedures. A decision should not be made hastily.」

「I understand your concern, Filius, but in times of crisis, we must also consider the safety and well-being of our students. The governors will be consulted, but we must act swiftly to protect Hogwarts and its inhabitants.」
「You can’t blame them. We’ve had precious little to celebrate for eleven years.」

"I know that. But that’s no reason to lose our heads. People are being downright careless, out on the streets in broad daylight, not even dressed in Muggle clothes, swapping rumors. A fine thing it would be if, on the very day You-Know-Who seems to have disappeared at last, the Muggles found out about us all. I suppose he really has gone, Dumbledore?"
「A lemon drop. They’re a kind of Muggle sweet I’m rather fond of.」
"No, thank you, Albus. As much as I appreciate your fondness for Muggle sweets, I believe we have more pressing matters to discuss at the moment."
「He’s coming.」
"Who is coming, Hagrid? Please be more specific."
「How dare you!」
"Miss Patil, I suggest you refrain from making baseless accusations. It is unbecoming of a Hogwarts student. Now, if you have any legitimate concerns or questions, I am willing to address them."
「It’s McGonagall!」
「I should have known that you three would be involved in something like this.」
「Hermione whispering」
"No, Miss Granger, you may not leave. We are in the midst of a very important discussion and your presence is required."

「Amycus think "“What’ve they done, the little whelps?” he screamed. “I’ll Cruciate the lot of ’em till they tell me who did it — and what’s the Dark Lord going to say?” he shrieked, standing over his sister and smacking himself on the forehead with his fist. “We haven’t got him, and they’ve gorn and killed her!”"」

"Such barbaric behavior! It is clear that you lack the understanding of the gravity of the situation. Resorting to violence and torture will not solve anything. We must focus on finding the truth and bringing justice, not inflicting pain upon innocent students. Your actions are disgraceful and unworthy of a true wizard."
「Amycus think "“No she bludgering well won’t!” bellowed Amycus. “Not after the Dark Lord gets hold of her! She’s gorn and sent for him, I felt me Mark burn, and he thinks we’ve got Potter!”"」

"Mr. Carrow, your language and behavior are utterly inappropriate. I will not tolerate such disrespect towards a fellow staff member. As for your claims about the Dark Lord, I assure you that your delusions will not change the truth. Alecto is merely stunned and will recover. Now, I suggest you cease your foolish ramblings and focus on the task at hand."
「It’s lucky it’s dark. I haven’t blushed so much since Madam Pomfrey told me she liked my new earmuffs.」
"Dumbledore, this is hardly the time for jokes. We are facing a grave situation and your levity is misplaced. We must focus on the matter at hand and find a solution to the current predicament."
「Professor McGonagall」
「Yes, what is it?」
「I would trust Hagrid with my life.」
「Indeed, Albus, Hagrid's loyalty and dedication are unquestionable. He may be rough around the edges, but his heart is in the right place. We are fortunate to have him on our side.」
「“Yes?” said Professor McGonagall, turning round, her eyebrows so close together they seemed to form one long, severe line.」
Professor McGonagall, can you please explain the concept of Transfiguration?

Transfiguration, my dear student, is a complex branch of magic that involves the alteration of the form or appearance of an object or living being. It requires great skill, concentration, and precision. Transfiguration can be performed on various levels, from simple transformations of inanimate objects to more advanced human transfiguration. It is a fundamental subject taught at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, and one that requires dedication and practice to master.
「Umbridge take many more notes while she sat in her corner」

「Miss Umbridge, I must remind you that this is not a time for note-taking. We are discussing the well-being and future of our fellow staff member, Professor Trelawney. Your focus should be on understanding and supporting the decisions made by the headmaster, rather than documenting every detail.」
「Certainly I knew, Minerva, But one does not parade the fact that one is All-Knowing. I frequently act as though I am not possessed of the Inner Eye, so as not to make others nervous.」

「Ah, Trelawney, always with your mystical claims. But I must say, your attempts at disguising your knowledge are rather feeble. It is not difficult to recognize your presence, especially when you speak in such a dramatic manner.」

「If you must know, Minerva, I have seen that poor Professor Lupin will not be with us for very long. He seems aware, himself, that his time is short. He positively fled when I offered to crystal gaze for him —」

「I must say, Professor Trelawney, your predictions have always been rather... unreliable. I highly doubt the accuracy of your divination regarding Professor Lupin's fate. It is best not to jump to conclusions based on such vague and questionable prophecies. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have important matters to attend to.」
「Dunno.」
「Well, I suggest you all think again.」
「I was just wondering whether Mr. Potter has quite the temperament for an Auror?」

"Well, if you must know, Dolores, Mr. Potter has shown remarkable courage and resilience throughout his time at Hogwarts. His determination to fight against dark forces and protect others is a testament to his potential as an Auror. However, it is not for you or anyone else to question his suitability for such a role. The final decision lies with the Ministry and those who recognize his true capabilities."
「Oh, no need, thank you, Minerva, I was just concerned that you might not have Harry’s most recent Defense Against the Dark Arts marks in front of you. I’m quite sure I slipped in a note . . .」
「What, this thing?Of course I understood it」
「I’m terribly sorry to have to contradict you, Minerva, but as you will see from my note, Harry has been achieving very poor results in his classes with me —」
「I should have made my meaning plainer」
「I’m terribly sorry to have to contradict you, Minerva, but as you will see from my note, Harry has been achieving very poor results in his classes with me —」

「I should have made my meaning plainer. He has achieved high marks in Defense Against the Dark Arts with previous professors, particularly Professor Lupin. As for his current performance, I believe it is a reflection of the inadequate teaching methods employed in your classroom, Dolores.」
「HARRY POTTER!」
"Mr. Potter, I trust you have a valid reason for causing such a commotion?"
「But Malfoy —」
「Enough, Mr. Weasley. We will address the matter of Mr. Malfoy separately. Right now, we need to focus on the urgent situation at hand.」
「Are you serious, Professor?」

"Absolutely, Wood. The Quidditch Cup is a serious matter, and I expect nothing less than your utmost dedication and commitment to the Gryffindor team. Now, gather your teammates and start practicing immediately. We have a championship to win."
「And we’d better stay outside the third-floor corridor. Come on.」

"Mr. Potter, I trust you have learned your lesson about venturing into forbidden areas. It would be wise to heed my advice and avoid the third-floor corridor. Now, come along, we have more pressing matters to attend to."
「We’ll go and get our stuff, said Ron in a hopeless sort of voice.」

"Mr. Weasley, this is not the time for hopelessness. We must gather our belongings swiftly and efficiently. We have a battle to prepare for. Now, pull yourself together and let us proceed with determination."
「And Dumbledore . . . Is he really . . . ?」
「Yes, Arthur. Dumbledore is gone.」
「A sallow-faced wizard walked back into his empty canvas」

"No, Mr. Potter, you cannot leave. It is crucial that you stay and face the challenges that lie ahead. We must confront the darkness together and protect Hogwarts. Your presence here is of utmost importance."
「Nearly there!」
"Potter, you must be cautious. The journey ahead is treacherous and filled with danger. But I have faith in your abilities. Stay focused and remember, the fate of our world rests on your shoulders."
「Get Madam Pomfrey,」
"Another attack, Minerva found him on the stairs. There was a bunch of grapes next to him, we think he was trying to sneak up here to visit Potter."
「We were going to — to go and see — Hermione, and we thought we’d sneak into the hospital wing, you know, and tell her the Mandrakes are nearly ready and, er, not to worry —」

「Mr. Weasley, I understand your concern for Miss Granger, but sneaking into the hospital wing is not the appropriate course of action. I assure you, Madam Pomfrey is well aware of the progress of the Mandrakes and their restorative properties. It is best to allow her to attend to Miss Granger's well-being without interference.」
「turned around, surprised」
"Miss Granger, I trust you have a valid reason for interrupting our conversation?"
「stared」
「Yes, Weasley, it is true.」
「Move along now, The Sorting Ceremony’s about to start.」
「Harry action」
"Potter, what on earth are you doing? You should be in class!"
「But he’s there! Potter’s there! Someone grab him!」

"Thank you, Miss Parkinson, for your observation. However, I must remind you that we are in the midst of a crisis and it is not the time for such actions. I suggest you focus on your own safety and follow the instructions given. Now, if you would kindly leave the Hall with Mr. Filch, the rest of your House will follow suit."
「Snape gripped the back of a chair very hard and said, “How can you be sure?”」

"Mr. Snape, I understand your concern, but I assure you, I have taken every measure to ensure the safety and security of Hogwarts. The Ministry of Magic has conducted thorough investigations, and we have implemented enhanced protective measures. We cannot let fear dictate our actions. Hogwarts must continue to stand as a beacon of education and hope for our students."
「“Who is it?” said Madam Hooch, who had sunk, weak-kneed, into a chair. “Which student?”」
「“Ginny Weasley,” said Professor McGonagall.」
「Where are the Carrows?」
「Wherever you told them to be, I expect, Severus.」
「I was under the impression that Alecto had apprehended an intruder」
「Really? And what gave you that impression?」
「I wonder what could have brought you out of your bed at this late hour?」
「I thought I heard a disturbance.」
「insisted on almost daily practices」

"Miss Johnson, I understand your dedication to Quidditch, but we must prioritize the safety and well-being of our students. Daily practices may not be feasible at the moment, considering the current circumstances. We must focus on the urgent matter at hand, which is the safety of our students and the resolution of the current crisis."
「Dumbledore bundle of blankets」
「Dumbledore is not so easily defeated, Fudge. He has faced far greater challenges than you can imagine.」
「Yes. He’ll have that scar forever.」
"Couldn't you do something about it, Dumbledore?"
「“Yeh did it, Harry! Yeh did it! An’ agains’ the Horntail an’ all, an’ yeh know Charlie said that was the wors’ —”」
"That was quite an accomplishment, Mr. Potter. Facing the Horntail and emerging victorious. Impressive, indeed."
「“Nice and easy does the trick, Potter,” he growled.」

「Indeed, Moody's advice is sound, Potter. Sometimes, a calm and measured approach is more effective than rushing headlong into a situation. Remember, patience and control are key in mastering any skill, be it in magic or in life.」
「I’ll kill Fred, he was going on about wrestling a troll.」

"Mr. Weasley, I understand that you may be feeling frustrated or upset, but resorting to violence is not the solution. It is important to address our concerns and emotions in a more constructive manner. Now, let us focus on the matter at hand and find a suitable resolution."
「Lee Jordan howling into the megaphone」
"Mr. Jordan, kindly refrain from using that megaphone in such a manner. It is highly disruptive and disrespectful. Now, if you will excuse us, we have urgent matters to attend to."
「Well, I’m stayin’. It’s me home, it’s bin me home since I was thirteen. An’ if there’s kids who wan’ me ter teach ’em, I’ll do it. But . . . I dunno . . . Hogwarts without Dumbledore . . .」

"Hagrid, I understand your concerns. Hogwarts without Dumbledore is indeed a difficult thought to bear. However, we must remember that Dumbledore entrusted us with the responsibility of carrying on his legacy. We must stand strong and continue to provide a safe and nurturing environment for our students. Your dedication to teaching is admirable, and I have no doubt that you will continue to inspire and guide them in the absence of our beloved headmaster."
「Ask him if he saw —」
"Ask him if he saw what, Mr. Weasley? Please be more specific in your inquiry."
「Certainly, good lady!」

"Sir Cadogan, I appreciate your enthusiasm, but this is not the time for gallantry. We must address the matter at hand. Now, if you have any relevant information or questions, please present them promptly."
「anxious as Professor McGonagall looked down his application and then consulted his O.W.L. results」

"Ah, Longbottom. Let's see... Herbology, fine. Professor Sprout will be delighted to see you back with an 'Outstanding' O.W.L. And you qualify for Defense Against the Dark Arts with 'Exceeds Expectations.' But the problem is Transfiguration. I'm sorry, Longbottom, but an 'Acceptable' really isn't good enough to continue to N.E.W.T. level. I just don't think you'd be able to cope with the coursework."
「This is . . . not the moment to discuss it. Dumbledore is dead. . . .」
「Indeed, Lupin, Dumbledore's passing is a great loss to us all. However, we must face the reality of the situation and address the matters at hand. We cannot dwell solely on our grief.」

「I’ve . . . I’ve done it, Professor. M-moved him. Professor Sprout’s got the kids back in bed. Professor Flitwick’s lyin’ down, but he says he’ll be all righ’ in a jiffy, an’ Professor Slughorn says the Ministry’s bin informed.」

Thank you, Hagrid, for your swift action. It is crucial that we ensure the safety and well-being of our students. I shall personally see to it that the Ministry is informed of the situation. In the meantime, please inform the Heads of Houses that I require their presence in my office immediately. You, Hagrid, are also requested to join us.

「I have not yet managed to find one, But it doesn’t matter if she won’t speak, I can take up the story from here. You will remember, Minister, that I sent you a report back in October that Potter had met a number of fellow students in the Hog’s Head in Hogsmeade —」
「And what is your evidence for that?」

「I have testimony from Willy Widdershins, Minerva, who happened to be in the bar at the time. He was heavily bandaged, it is true, but his hearing was quite unimpaired, He heard every word Potter said and hastened straight to the school to report to me —」
「Oh, so that’s why he wasn’t prosecuted for setting up all those regurgitating toilets! What an interesting insight into our justice system!」

「I have testimony from Willy Widdershins, Minerva, who happened to be in the bar at the time. He was heavily bandaged, it is true, but his hearing was quite unimpaired, He heard every word Potter said and hastened straight to the school to report to me —」
「Oh, so that’s why he wasn’t prosecuted for setting up all those regurgitating toilets! What an interesting insight into our justice system!」
「Don’t mind Hermione, Lavender, she doesn’t think other people’s pets matter very much.」

"Mr. Weasley, I must remind you to show respect for your fellow students and their opinions. While Miss Granger may have her own perspective, it is important to consider the feelings and attachments others may have towards their pets. Kindness and empathy are qualities we should all strive to uphold."
「Please, Professor, I — I think I’ve lost —」
「Lost what, Longbottom?」
「Professor, my aunt and uncle — er — forgot to sign my form,」
「I'm afraid not, Potter. You heard what I said. No form, no visiting the village. That's the rule.」
「Ron action」
*groans in pain* "I... I can't move, Professor. It bit me... the snake bit me."
「Oh n — Professor, can’t I go and do the trophy room, too?」
「Certainly not. Professor Lockhart requested you particularly. Eight o’clock sharp, both of you.」
「Pettigrew . . . that fat little boy who was always tagging around after them at Hogwarts?」
